content.processed:
I need to travel to visit my family or partner

If you need to travel to your family or partner in necessary cases, check what rules apply in individual countries on the Traveler's Map.

If this information is not explicitly written on the given page, contact the info line of the Ministry of the Foreign Affairs: +420 222 264 222 (available on MON-FRI from 08:00 - 16:00, however from 18.2. even outside this time frame there will be basic information regarding traveling to other countries available).

Upon return

Currently, the following rules of entry into the Czech Republic are now being applied: Without any conditions, it is possible to travel to the Czech Republic only from countries that are on the list of countries with a low risk of infection. If you have been in a country with a medium, high or very high risk of infection for more than 12 hours in the last 14 days (this category includes all countries not listed above), the following rules apply to you. 

Journey from countries with a medium risk of infection (orange):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or a PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronic form).

Journey from countries with a high risk of infection (red):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or a PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronic form).
  3. Within 5 days of arrival in the Czech Republic, undergo a PCR test and submit the result to the appropriate hygiene station. Until then, remain in quarantine.

Journey from countries with a very high risk of infection (dark red):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or a PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronic form).
  3. Within 5 days of arrival in the Czech Republic, undergo a PCR test and submit the result to the appropriate hygiene station. Until then, remain in quarantine.

There are exceptions to these conditions. It does not apply, for example, to transit within 12 hours, international transport workers (holders of the certification), children under 5, cross-border workers and students (certified as a worker or student), for those Czech citizens who have undergone covid-19 in the last 90 days and had isolation ( with a certificate from a doctor) and for family members, companions of Czech citizens traveling with a Czech citizen, who have a diplomatic note issued by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (certificate of covid-19 disease and isolation in a red or dark red country). Additional exceptions can be found in the current measure.

 For travel from all three groups of countries (orange, red, dark red), it is mandatory to wear an FFP2 respirator or at least a medical veil for 10 days after arrival in the Czech Republic.

The exact conditions for entry into the territory of the Czech Republic, including exceptions, can be found in English clearly in the table of the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic.

My family or partner comes to visit from abroad

A number of rules and exceptions apply to this category of foreigners entering the Czech Republic.

Details on the conditions of entry of Czech partners and EU citizens living in the Czech Republic.

In case of doubts or questions, please contact: cestovani.covid19@mvcr.cz
